skill.name: fractal-docs-generator
skill.summary: Directory-level CLAUDE.md generator that creates documentation tables when directory structures change.
skill.author: Dimon94

security_audit.summary: All 11 static findings are false positives. The scanner misinterpreted Chinese metadata text as cryptographic algorithms and markdown template syntax as shell execution patterns. This is a documentation generator skill that creates CLAUDE.md files. No actual security risks identified.

content.value_statement: Projects often lack documentation for directory structures. This skill automatically generates CLAUDE.md files with file responsibility tables when directories are created or modified, keeping documentation synchronized with code architecture.
actual_capabilities: Generates CLAUDE.md files when directories are created or modified
Creates documentation tables listing files with their role and responsibility
Uses standard role categories: entry point, core, utility, types, config, tests
Works alongside file-header-guardian for complete project documentation
limitations: Does not analyze file contents to determine responsibilities automatically
Requires manual specification of file roles and responsibilities
Only generates markdown tables, does not write prose documentation
Triggered by directory operations, not file content changes

use_cases.title: New feature module documentation
use_cases.description: When creating a new feature directory, automatically generate a CLAUDE.md documenting the module structure and file responsibilities.
use_cases.target_user: Feature developers working on modular codebases

use_cases.title: Team onboarding documentation
use_cases.description: Maintain up-to-date project structure documentation that helps new team members understand the codebase organization.

use_cases.title: Architecture consistency enforcement
use_cases.description: Ensure all project directories follow consistent documentation patterns with standardized file role tables.

prompt_templates.title: Basic directory documentation
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a CLAUDE.md for the new {directory_name} directory. Include a table listing the main files with their role and one-sentence responsibility.
prompt_templates.scenario: When creating a new feature or module directory

prompt_templates.title: Complete module documentation
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a comprehensive CLAUDE.md for the {directory_name} module. Include all files with their role (entry, core, utility, types, config, test) and specific responsibility description.
prompt_templates.scenario: When setting up a new microservice or major component

prompt_templates.title: Refactoring documentation update
prompt_templates.prompt: Update the CLAUDE.md in {directory_name} to reflect the new file structure after the refactor. Add new files and remove deprecated ones.
prompt_templates.scenario: After restructuring a module or component

prompt_templates.title: Cross-module documentation
prompt_templates.prompt: Create CLAUDE.md files for multiple related directories: {directories}. Ensure consistent role classifications across all modules.
prompt_templates.scenario: When establishing documentation standards across multiple modules

output_examples.input: Create CLAUDE.md for a new auth directory
output: | jwt.helper.ts | utility | JWT signing and verification |

output_examples.input: Generate documentation for a utils directory
output: | date.helper.ts | core | Date formatting and parsing |

best_practices: Use consistent role categories across all directories for predictable documentation structure
Keep responsibility descriptions brief and focused on the file's external interface
Update CLAUDE.md immediately after adding or removing files in the directory
Coordinate with file-header-guardian for complete project documentation coverage
anti_patterns: Leaving responsibility descriptions empty or too vague
Inconsistent role classifications across different directories
Creating CLAUDE.md without reviewing the documented file responsibilities
Forgetting to update documentation when refactoring moves files between directories

faq.question: What triggers this skill?
faq.answer: The skill triggers on directory creation, renaming, moving, or when files within a directory change. It does not trigger on file content changes alone.

faq.question: How are file roles determined?
faq.answer: File roles are specified manually by the developer. The skill provides standard categories but does not analyze file contents.

faq.question: Can I customize the template format?
faq.answer: The skill uses a standard markdown table format. You can edit the generated CLAUDE.md to add additional sections as needed.

faq.question: Does this work with nested directories?
faq.answer: Yes, each directory can have its own CLAUDE.md. The skill triggers on any directory structure change at any depth.

faq.question: How does this differ from file-header-guardian?
faq.answer: fractal-docs-generator manages directory-level CLAUDE.md files, while file-header-guardian manages file-level documentation headers. They work together for complete coverage.

faq.question: What file roles are supported?
faq.answer: Standard roles include: entry point, core logic, utility, type definitions, configuration, and test files. You can add custom roles as needed.
